H0.text: There is no life in any of an animal's parts when it hibernates.

H1.text: It stops breathing when an animal hibernates.

H2.text: Its temperature is higher than when it is active when an animal hibernates.

H3.text: It is absorbing energy for use when it is active.

H4.text: Using less energy than when it is active is what happens when an animal hibernates.

A5.text: To achieve this energy saving, an endothermic animal decreases its metabolic rate and thereby its body temperature.

A6.text: Hibernation functions to conserve energy when sufficient food is not available.
